content: our alpaca and silk blend birdie is a firm favorite for all kinds of projects held double knit by itself or stranded along with another yarn for this project we invite you to pick three colors and enjoy the color play of simple regimental stripes knit into this hybrid triangular shawl and cowl it s an easily styled piece that you ll knit again and again samples shown red cowl birdie in colors mc paisley cc1 waverly and cc2 pinafore blue cowl birdie in colors mc alpine flannel cc1 glass jar and cc2 sour apple sizes one size finished measurements approx 22 circumference at neck opening 42 circumference at bottom x 20 deep along center spine yarn requirements *please note these are yarn estimates the amount used will depend on yarn your personal gauge and any modifications you make * the lamb & kid birdie 74% alpaca 26% silk 328 yards per 50g 3 skeins 1 each in 3 different colors yarn held doubled throughout or fingering-weight yarn to hold double in the following amounts total 520 yards / 475m mc 265 yards / 242m cc1 185 yards / 169m cc2 70 yards / 64m note if you are using a worsted-weight yarn held singly you will need half of these yardage amounts needles *needles listed are suggested * gauge needle us 7 4 5mm 24 circular needle tools darning needle 5 markers gauge *gauge is not critical for this project although it may affect yardage requirements you want a finished fabric with drape and body * approx 16 sts and 24 row/rounds = 4 in stockinette st using gauge needle after blocking we prefer just a quick
